Node.definition: = man, also known as Gideon (גִּדְעֹון) referred to as Jerubbesheth (יְרֻבֶּשֶׁת) in a case of euphemistic substitution; ◄ son of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= man, also known as Jerubbaal (יְרֻבַּעַל) ◄ son of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

Node.gloss: to set up (a tent)|to erect (a tent)|to encamp
Node.definition: = action by which an individual or group of people settles in a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
= location; ► where Gideon (גִּדְעֹון) encamped with his army before attacking the Midianites (מִדְיָנִי)
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= man; ◄ son of Midian (מִדְיָן) son of Keturah (קְטוּרָה) wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= hill; ► place where the Midianites (מִדְיָן) were encamped when they were attacked by Gideon (גִּדְעֹון)
= hill; ► place where Midianites (מִדְיָן) encamped during time of Gideon (גִּדְעֹון)

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man, also known as Jerubbaal (יְרֻבַּעַל) ◄ son of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which humans experience fear
= process by which humans shake or tremble violently and involuntarily, ◄ caused by fear or another unnerving experience
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
meaning unsure: = action by which humans turn around and move back in the direction of the place where they came from

= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

literally: children of a town, region, nation; hence: = people, animals, or products that are inhabitants of or originating from a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the offspring of that place
literally: to lie; hence: = state in which a group of people are temporarily residing in a certain place

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

= large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: there is no counting (of it); hence: = state in which objects cannot be counted or measured because of their abundance

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= man, also known as Jerubbaal (יְרֻבַּעַל) ◄ son of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: a camp; hence: = a relatively large group of people, such as nomads or soldiers, moving from one camping place to another
= man; ◄ son of Midian (מִדְיָן) son of Keturah (קְטוּרָה) wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name
= causative action by which humans divide an object or a set of objects into two or more parts

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

= piece of wood burning on one end; ► used to provide light or as a means of igniting something else; ≈ associated with light and destruction

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
